trans-unit.source: How to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to connect to an Azure SQL database using SSMS.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to install SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and then use SSMS to connect and query your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to install SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and then use SSMS to connect and query your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: An SQL Database AdventureWorks sample database as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: An SQL Database AdventureWorks sample database as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Go to the download page for SQL Server 2014 Express, click Download, and choose either the 32-bit version (x86) or the 64-bit version (x64) of the MgmtStudio download.
trans-unit.target: Go to the download page for SQL Server 2014 Express, click Download, and choose either the 32-bit version (x86) or the 64-bit version (x64) of the MgmtStudio download.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MgtmtStudio32BIT or MgmtStudio64BIT</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MgtmtStudio32BIT or MgmtStudio64BIT</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts as you install SSMS using the default settings.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts as you install SSMS using the default settings.

trans-unit.source: Once downloaded, search for SQL Server 2014 Management Studio on your PC and then start SSMS.
trans-unit.target: Once downloaded, search for SQL Server 2014 Management Studio on your PC and then start SSMS.

trans-unit.source: Open SSMS.
trans-unit.target: Open SSMS.

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to Server dialog box, in the Server name box, type the server name in the format <servername>.database.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to Server dialog box, in the Server name box, type the server name in the format <servername>.database.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication list, select SQL Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication list, select SQL Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Login and Password you specified when you created your SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Login and Password you specified when you created your SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to server dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to server dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Options button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Options button.

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to database box, enter AdventureWorks and then click Connect.
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to database box, enter AdventureWorks and then click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the firewall of the logical server you have created allows connections from your local computer.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the firewall of the logical server you have created allows connections from your local computer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, navigate to the AdventureWorks database.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, navigate to the AdventureWorks database.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the database and then select New Query.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the database and then select New Query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New query</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New query</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the query window, copy and paste the following code.
trans-unit.target: In the query window, copy and paste the following code.

trans-unit.source: Click the Execute button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Execute button.

trans-unit.source: The following screen shot shows a successful query.
trans-unit.target: The following screen shot shows a successful query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sucess</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sucess</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use Transact-SQL statements to create or manage databases.
trans-unit.target: You can use Transact-SQL statements to create or manage databases.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>CREATE DATABASE (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Managing Azure SQL Database using SQL Server Management Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>CREATE DATABASE (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Managing Azure SQL Database using SQL Server Management Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also log events to Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: You can also log events to Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get started with SQL database auditing</linkText><title></title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get started with SQL database auditing</linkText><title></title> for more information.
